thread.title: Manny Pacquiao in talks with Floyd Mayweather for farewell fight - Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: Manny Pacquiao in talks with Floyd Mayweather for farewell fight - Stuff.co.nz

title: Manny Pacquiao in talks with Floyd Mayweather for farewell fight - Stuff.co.nz
text:
Manny Pacquiao in talks with Floyd Mayweather for farewell fight Last updated 13:23, October 9 2015 STEVE MARCUS/REUTERS 
Manny Pacquiao wants one more high-profile bout before moving into politics fulltime. 
Manny Pacquiao says he is in negotiations with Floyd Mayweather and Amir Khan for what would likely be his last fight before moving into politics fulltime. 
Earlier this year, the Filipino and Mayweather finally went toe-to-toe in what was billed as 'The Fight of the Century' only to end up a damp squib as the brash American cruised to a unanimous decision. 
Despite the lack of fireworks, Mayweather and Pacquiao are still regarded as the best pound-for-pound fighters in the sport and a rematch would be hugely lucrative for both boxers, while a fight against former stable-mate Khan would also generate plenty of interest. 
Speaking to news agency AFP at the AIBA World Boxing Championships in Doha, the 36-year-old confirmed he is in talks with Mayweather and Khan but had no preference over who to fight. 
"I will fight anybody, anywhere," said Pacquiao, who is likely to run for a seat in the Philippines senate next May. 
"I am going to fight probably before the election. The election is coming next year, May, and before that I will probably have one fight. 
"We are going to finalise by November or December." 
Pacquiao, whose record stands at 57 wins, two draws and six losses, blamed a shoulder injury for his poor showing against Mayweather and is desperate to make amends before finally hanging up his gloves. 
Mayweather retired last month following another easy victory against Andre Berto to extend his record to a perfect 49-0. 
However, having previously come out of retirement and with the chance to crack the half-century, few would be surprised if he returned for one last fight against his old rival.
